Headline: The Musical Genius Behind the “Friends” Theme Also Wrote “September”
Article_Body:
At the beginning of 1978, Allee Willis was living off of food stamps. But by the end of the year, she’d sold 10 million records … and that’s just part of the story. The musical genius is responsible for over 1,000 songs, including hits like Earth, Wind & Fire’s “September,” the entirety of Broadway’s “The Color Purple,” and the iconic, unforgettable “Friends” theme song. Oh, and she did this all without being able to write music or play a single instrument.

UPDATE: We are sad to note that Allee Willis died in December, 2019. She was 72.
